title: Erigon alpha freezes and needs to be killed
body:
v2022.05.02-alpha

After +9 days doing the initial sync, for some reason (I'm not sure if it is related to a certain stage) it started to freeze at random moments and it needs to be killed.

When it happens, it prints the stack trace below (it is not complete, can't paste it all here) and becomes non responsible, Ctrl+C does not work anymore, it needs to be killed with kill -9. Still, it takes some time to be killed, it looks like the process is stuck in some I/O operation.

The first time it happened, it was executing stage 13, but after restarting erigon I saw it happening on stage 6 and 8, so I don't think it is related to them. 


I think Erigon2 consuming more RAM now - because of known issue: each snapshot store some jump table in RAM and it's big now (8Gb on mainnet I think). So, my guess is - you getting out of RAM - then your machine start suffer or start swapping. 

We plan to fix this problem but not in 1st priority.
